title: How to find 1's complement and 2's complement of a given number - Quora

response.answer_text: This is a topic in Discrete Mathematics. With a binary number, you find the 1’s complement by inverting the numbers, switching bits. In binary you only have 1s and 0s. So if your number was 100101101 then the 1’s complement is 011010010. The two’s complement is the 1’s complement with 1 added to the number. So for example, the 2’s complement of 100101101 would be 011010011. The one’s complement of 1010 would be 0101. The two’s complement of 1010 would be 0110.

To find the 1’s complement, just flip all the bits. To find the 2’s complement, flip all the bits and add one. Example: 0010 0110 (that’s 26 in hex, 38 in denary (or decimal) ): 0010 0110 --- now flip the bits to get... 1101 1001 is the 1’s complement --- add one to get... 1101 1010 is the 2’s complement
